{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a history of breast feeding up to the age of 7 months, followed by introduction of solid foods with emphasis on vegetables, meat, fish, eggs, and bread. The mother tried withdrawing dairy products but it did not help. This suggests that the patient may have an intolerance to certain food substances. The symptoms of diarrhea, stunted growth, abdominal cramps, and rash suggest a chronic condition. The laboratory results show positive anti-transglutaminase and anti-endomysial antibodies which is consistent with celiac disease. Therefore, we expect villous atrophy on intestinal biopsy.", "answer_choice": "C"}
